org.jetel.ctl

Class CTLAbstractTransformAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.ctl.CTLAbstractTransformAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transform
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CTLGraphParameterValueTransformAdapter, CTLRecordDenormalizeAdapter, CTLRecordGenerateAdapter, CTLRecordNormalizeAdapter, CTLRecordPartitionAdapter, CTLRecordRollupAdapter, CTLRecordTransformAdapter

    public class CTLAbstractTransformAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Transform
    Base class of all CTL transform classes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected TransformLangExecutor executor
      The CTL executor to be used for this transform adapter.

      The logger used by this class.
      protected static java.lang.Object[] NO_ARGUMENTS
      An empty array of arguments used for calls to functions without any arguments.
      protected static DataRecord[] NO_DATA_RECORDS
      An empty array of data records used for calls to functions that do not access to any data records.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CTLAbstractTransformAdapter

        public CTLAbstractTransformAdapter(TransformLangExecutor executor,
                           org.apache.commons.logging.Log logger)
        Constructs a CTLAbstractTransformAdapter for a given CTL executor and logger.
        Parameters:
        executor - the CTL executor to be used by this transform adapter, may not be null
        executor - the logger to be used by this transform adapter, may not be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either the executor or the logger is null

      • setNode

        public void setNode(Node node)
        Calls to this method are ignored, associating a graph is meaningless in case of interpreted CTL.

        Parameters:
        node - a graph Node to be associated

        public Node getNode()
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: Transform
        Called during each graph run before the transform is executed. May be used to allocate and initialize resources required by the transform. All resources allocated within this method should be released by the Transform.postExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        preExecute in interface Transform
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if an error occurred during resource allocation and initialization

      • postExecute

        public void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: Transform
        Called during each graph run after the entire transform was executed. Should be used to free any resources allocated within the Transform.preExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        postExecute in interface Transform
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if an error occurred during resource clean-up

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        Description copied from interface: Transform
        Called to report any user-defined error message if an error occurred during the transform.
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface Transform
        Returns:
        a user-defined error message if an error occurred

      • finished

        @Deprecated
public final void finished()
        Deprecated. Use postExecute() method.
        Description copied from interface: Transform
        Called at the end of the transform after all input data records were processed.
        Specified by:
        finished in interface Transform

      • reset

        @Deprecated
public final void reset()
        Deprecated. Use preExecute() method.
        Description copied from interface: Transform
        Resets the transform to the initial state (for another execution). This method may be called only if the transform was successfully initialized before.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface Transform
